Let us start by ﬁnding the optimal coordinates z1n,...,z Mn of the projec-
tions ˜xn for n = 1,...,N . Consider Figure 10.7(b), where the principal
subspace is spanned by a single vector b. Geometrically speaking, ﬁnding
the optimal coordinates zcorresponds to ﬁnding the representation of the
linear projection ˜xwith respect to bthat minimizes the distance between
˜x−x. From Figure 10.7(b), it is clear that this will be the orthogonal
projection, and in the following we will show exactly this.
